StudentObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

StudentObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

StudentObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Student_and_Universal_ID_Data.description: The Student who is being Referenced.

Universal_IdentifierObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Universal_IdentifierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Universal_IdentifierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Student_and_Universal_ID_Data.description: Universal ID of the Student who is being Referenced.

Prospective_Student_Request_References.description: Reference to the Student instances to be retrieved

validation.validation: Submit either a Universal ID or Student Reference for the same student.
The specified student has been merged with another student record. Specify the merged student instead.

description: Container for the reference to the Student to be retrieved

Student_ApplicationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Student_ApplicationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Education_Test_Registration_Number_Crite.description: The Education Test Result Registration Number of a Student's Education Test

Prospective_Student_Request_Criteria.description: Container for the Education Test Result Registration Number field used as criteria when retrieving Students

description: Container for Student Request Criteria data

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.

Include Personal Information Data Response Group
Include Education Test Data Response Group

description: Container for Student Response Group data
